DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Organ System Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of evaluating the final state of a subject or study subject who experienced an adverse event, which takes place after the adverse event occurs. A coded value specifying the anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions. EXAMPLE(S): gastrointestinal system, urinary system, hematopoietic system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Organ System Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
